pre.gribviz module

class pre.gribviz.gribdata(day_range=[1, 1], month_range=[1, 1], year_range=[2022, 2022], prefix='levels', extension='grib', path='/storage/wrf/nobackup/munters/ERA5/')[source]

Bases: object

A class to represent and manipulate GRIB data for WRF simulation preprocessing.

day_range

The range of days to process.

Type:

list of int

month_range

The range of months to process.

Type:

list of int

year_range

The range of years to process.

Type:

list of int

prefix

The prefix for the filenames.

Type:

str

extension

The extension for the filenames.

Type:

str

path

The path to the directory containing the GRIB files.

Type:

str

compute_theta_stats(point, time, hlevs, th_1d)[source]

Compute potential temperature statistics.

Parameters:

  • point (list of float) – The latitude and longitude of the point.

  • time (list of datetime) – The time series.

  • hlevs (list of float) – The height levels.

  • th_1d (list of float) – The potential temperature data.

Returns:

The potential temperature statistics.

Return type:

DataFrame

compute_wind_stats(u, v, lat=0, lon=0)[source]

Compute wind statistics.

Parameters:

  • point (list of float) – The latitude and longitude of the point.

  • time (list of datetime) – The time series.

  • hlevs (list of float) – The height levels.

  • u_1d (list of float) – The u-component of the wind.

  • v_1d (list of float) – The v-component of the wind.

Returns:

The wind statistics.

Return type:

DataFrame

monts_in_year = 12
path = '/storage/wrf/nobackup/munters/ERA5'
piecewise_linear_potential_theta(z, theta_ref, gamma_abl, gamma, dtheta_inv, z_inv, delta_inv)[source]

Compute the piecewise-linear potential temperature model.

Parameters:

  • z (float) – The height.

  • theta_ref (float) – The reference potential temperature.

  • gamma_abl (float) – The adiabatic lapse rate in the atmospheric boundary layer.

  • gamma (float) – The free atmospheric lapse rate.

  • dtheta_inv (float) – The potential temperature inversion strength.

  • z_inv (float) – The height of the inversion.

  • delta_inv (float) – The inversion width.

Returns:

The potential temperature profile on z.

Return type:

float

prefix = 'levels'

start_month = 1
start_year = 2022
theta_extract_timeseries(point, hlevs, hourly_step=1)[source]

Extract potential temperature time series.

Parameters:

  • point (list of float) – The latitude and longitude of the point.

  • hlevs (list of float) – The height levels.

  • hourly_step (int, optional) – The hourly step for extraction (default is 1).

Returns:

The time series and potential temperature data.

Return type:

tuple

variable_extract_timeseries_lvl(var='t', level='500')[source]

Extract the time series of a scalar variable defined on pressure levels.

Parameters:

  • var (str) – The variable to extract.

  • level (str) – The pressure level to extract.

Returns:

The time series and variable data.

Return type:

list of tuple

windspeed_plot_timeseries_10m(path2output='./snapshots_ws10')[source]

Plot time series of 10 wind speed. Data must be defined on single levels.

  • var (str) – The variable to plot.
